issue.title: `glooctl check` timeouts configurable in `glooctl-config.yaml`

labels.name: keep pr updated
labels.description: signals bulldozer to keep pr up to date with base branch

issue.body:
# Description

For getting each resource type in `glooctl check` the `glooctl-config.yaml` now allows more granular control over timeouts. New settings also exist for overriding the default timeout for each individual check as well as a timeout for the entire check.

# Context

Users were reporting issues with hardcoded timeouts not being long enough for large clusters even though at this time we only had hardcoded timeouts for two of our checks. There were also UX concerns about having multiple ways to set timeouts (i.e. flags, ENV vars, files) and their various interactions prompting some of the changes around removing references to the KUBECONFIG env var.

issue.title: `glooctl check --timeout <float64>`
issue.body:
# Description

Added  --timeout flag to `glooctl check` to adjust the cluster connection check timeout.

# Context

	Prior to this change we hardcoded the timeout to five seconds which was not sufficient for large clusters given the mechanics of the check. To do this check, we create a settings client and get settings in the cluster and assure that an error has not occurred. The check would ideally be O(1) but in reality is O(#settings in cluster).

issue.title: 7406 trace context support (#7508)

labels.name: keep pr updated
labels.description: signals bulldozer to keep pr up to date with base branch

issue.body:
* Cherry-pick c511b2f6 onto master branch

Initial commit of tracing plugin changes

At this point, the plugin should in theory have all translation implemented. However, there is no error checking present in the plugin. A basic unit test exists for this work, but all it does it ensure that no errors occurred. The unit test also does not yet validate the content of the output object.

* Only set GrpcService if OcagentAddress is empty

This was creating an error in Envoy - if the GrpcService object being sent to Envoy had an empty string, then it would not accept the configuration.

* Final version of opencensus changes

This commit includes a translation fix and simplification of the API. Originally, we were outputting an object of type GrpcService_EnvoyGrpc_ for the grpcAddress option, but the Envoy plugin only supports the GrpcService_GoogleGrpc_ type. So we fix that here. We also simplify the protobuf API to use a oneof for specifying HTTP or GRPC.

I'm committing this now because we have decided to drop using OpenCensus due to the fact that it cannot be reconfigured. A lot of the work on this effort will be discarded, so I am saving it here for posterity.

* Rename all strings in opencensus.proto to opentelemetry

* Rename opencensus.proto to opentelemetry.proto

* Rewrite everything to use opentelemetry instead

So far, I have only tested manually, but it seems to work okay. One odd behaviour is that Envoy only seems to report information to the echo server on shutdown.

Unit tests aren't doing anything serious at the moment and need to be improved. It will also be necessary to write an e2e test for this. But otherwise, things seem to be working much more smoothly than they did with opencensus.

* Replace "Census" with "Telemetry" in function name

* Remove autogenerated opencensus documentation file

* Update unit test

* Add changelog

* Add e2e test for opentelemetry

* Update docs/content/reference/api/github.com/solo-io/gloo/projects/gloo/api/external/envoy/config/trace/v3/opentelemetry.proto.sk.md

Co-authored-by: Art <artberger@users.noreply.github.com>

* Incorporate some changes from Sam

* Remove race conditions from e2e tests

The major issue here was a pair of variables with near-global scope: collectorApiHit and collectionURLPath. Both of these were triggering go's race condition flags, probably because they were being written to and read from ginkgo's setup and teardown callbacks.

There was also an issue in shutting down the collection server, which is addressed by a comment around where the change was made.

* Some comments and docstring fixes

* Add default statements in tracing plugin type translation

* Changelog improvements

Co-authored-by: soloio-bulldozer[bot] <48420018+soloio-bulldozer[bot]@users.noreply.github.com>
Co-authored-by: Art <artberger@users.noreply.github.com>

issue.title: Add support for operator annotations
issue.body:
This allows us to add annotations to our gloo-mesh management server pod to allow for discovery of Gloo Mesh resources.

Our helm command will now include: 

```
    --set glooMeshMgmtServer.serviceAccount.extraAnnotations.\"eks\.amazonaws\.com/role-arn\"=arn:aws:iam::410461945957:role/gloo-mesh-e2e-role \
```

When trying to configure our management server to have the proper credentials for discovery.

issue.title: first commit
issue.body:
# Description

Added a `--read-only` flag to `glooctl check` which disables any port forward gets and any checking of resulting resources.

# Context

This change now allows us to have a version of glooctl check that doesn't require RBAC create permissions. As this is only a check ideally we should not be writing to the cluster by default but this flag introduces a way to prevent writing to the cluster albeit by bypassing some checks.

labels.name: keep pr updated
labels.description: signals bulldozer to keep pr up to date with base branch

issue.body:
# Description
Small fixes for glooctl

# Context
## --with-gloo-fed=false
While testing installations of Gloo Federation, I was unable to use the `--with-gloo-fed=false` flag. As a quick workaround, I ensure that the flag only takes effect if the value is true and I supply the proper helm values in the `--values` flag.

## waitForCrds
Ensure that after performing an installation, we at least wait for the Settings CRD to be registered.

I had noticed during some gloo fed testing:
```
Gloo failed to install! Detailed logs available at /home/runner/.gloo/debug.log.
      Error: installing Gloo Edge Enterprise in gateway mode: unable to build kubernetes objects from release manifest: unable to recognize "": no matches for kind "Settings" in version "gloo.solo.io/v1"
      : exit status 1
  occurred
```

issue.title: Fix for `glooctl check` failure
issue.body:
# Description

When running `glooctl check` on a cluster with gateway-proxy deployments that have zero replicas.

# Context

Since we expect a deployment to have at least one replica, we perform a GET which fails in the case of zero replicas since there does not exist a pod that can respond. This PR has two remedial changes:
* If the cluster has zero gateway-proxy deployments, we fail since this is considered an unhealthy install.
* For each gateway-proxy deployment that has zero replicas, we fail since the created Gateway and Proxy CRs have no way to resolve incoming traffic.

labels.name: keep pr updated
labels.description: signals bulldozer to keep pr up to date with base branch

issue.body:
* Fix HTTP protocol options issue and update unit tests

The core issue here is that we are guarding against users providing http1 options and simultaneously configuring the upstream to use http2. The original code had a simple guard `in.GetConnectionConfig() != nil` to protect this. However, this was too broad as there were other options in the `ConnectionConfig` object that should have been allowed to be specified (and weren't). Instead, it is only the `ConnectionConfig.Http1ProtocolOptions` object that has these protocol-specific optionst that we want to prevent users from enabling when http2 is selected. This fix updates the statement to use this more specific condition.

I also found that the unit tests were a bit messy here. The `createTestUpstreamWithProtocolOptions` function was updated to be a bit more direct and less abstract in the object it creates. We drop the boolean `includeProtocolSelection` boolean - it defaults to 0 anyways (`USE_CONFIGURED_PROTOCOL`), so why not just use the existing `protocolSelection` parameter to that function instead? Additionally, create parameters to set `useHttp2` and `Http1ProtocolOptions`. The tests were updated according to the new signature, and this signature makes the deny condition much easier to test for.

* Change createTestUpstreamWithProtocolOptions to use a Http1ProtocolOptions object

Instead of using a boolean, just pass the object directly into the function

* Add changelog

* Refactor tests into separate cases

* Simplify if-condition

This is will not raise a nil-pointer exception because the `ConnectionConfig` field is never dereferenced if the object it is called on is `nil`:

    func (x *Upstream) GetConnectionConfig() *ConnectionConfig {
      if x != nil {
        return x.ConnectionConfig
      }
      return nil
    }

labels.description: signals bulldozer to keep pr up to date with base branch

issue.body:
# Description

This fixes a bug whereby the generated cluster for an Upstream containing `httpProxyHostname` loses the UpstreamTlsContext that is otherwise included via `static.useTls`. 

We also will use Envoy's native [Internal Listeners](https://www.envoyproxy.io/docs/envoy/latest/configuration/other_features/internal_listener) in lieu of in-memory pipes to facilitate the TCP tunnel. This feature is only available in Envoy v1.22.0 and later, so backports of the bugfix above will not include this change.

# Context

Users run into this bug when generating multiple routes which route to a single CONNECT proxy upstream. The cluster that is generated by the Upstream definition should contain a `TransportSocket` which defines an `UpstreamTlsContext` when `static.useTls` is set on the Upstream. The `UpstreamTlsContext` is removed from the config when multiple routes are defined on a VirtualService pointing at the same Upstream.

# Testing
Unit tests were added to validate that an `UpstreamTlsContext` defined on a cluster persists regardless of how many of routes are created against the Upstream

issue.title: [1.12] Backport Recent Fixes

labels.name: keep pr updated
labels.description: signals bulldozer to keep pr up to date with base branch

issue.body:
# Work In Progress
This PR is an accumulated set of changes that will be backported. We can remove the label once we have each of the changes merged into this branch.

# Description

A set of recent fixes that are being backported into 1.12

# Explicitly disable leader election
Signed off by:
- [x] @jenshu 
- [x] @elcasteel 

Backport of: https://github.com/solo-io/gloo/pull/7351

Leader Election does not need to execute when only running a single replica of Gloo. We've noticed that there are certain Edge cases where leader election stops functioning properly (ApiServer throttling or network issues, node failure).

As a short-term solution, we want to make it possible so that users who are not yet trying to receiving the benefits of an HA control-plane, can disable the functionality altogether.

## Testing
### Helm e2e Testing
To confirm that the helm setting actually behaves the way we would expect in a cluster, you can follow:

1. Build the images locally, and load them into a kind cluster: 
```
CLUSTER_NAME=edge VERSION=0.0.0-edge CLUSTER_NODE_VERSION=v1.22.4  ./ci/deploy-to-kind-cluster.sh
```

2. Perform a helm install without this new value
```
helm install gloo _test/gloo-0.0.1-fork.tgz -n gloo-system --create-namespace
```

3. Observe the logs indicate the leader election is taking place
```
 kubectl logs deploy/gloo -n gloo-system -f
...

{"level":"info","ts":"2022-10-21T17:40:49.888Z","caller":"probes/healthz.go:23","msg":"healthz server starting at :8765"}
{"level":"info","ts":"2022-10-21T17:40:49.888Z","caller":"stats/stats.go:96","msg":"Stats server starting at :9091"}
{"level":"info","ts":"2022-10-21T17:40:49.897Z","logger":"gloo.v1.event_loop","caller":"v1/setup_event_loop.sk.go:79","msg":"event loop started","version":"0.0.1-fork"}
I1021 17:40:49.897247       1 leaderelection.go:248] attempting to acquire leader lease gloo-system/gloo...
I1021 17:40:49.907310       1 leaderelection.go:258] successfully acquired lease gloo-system/gloo

# Description

issue.body:
# Description

Added  --timeout flag to `glooctl check` to adjust the cluster connection check timeout.

# Context

	Prior to this change we hardcoded the timeout to five seconds which was not sufficient for large clusters given the mechanics of the check. To do this check, we create a settings client and get settings in the cluster and assure that an error has not occurred. The check would ideally be O(1) but in reality is O(#settings in cluster).

issue.title: 7406 trace context support (#7508)

labels.name: keep pr updated
labels.description: signals bulldozer to keep pr up to date with base branch

issue.body:
* Cherry-pick c511b2f6 onto master branch

Initial commit of tracing plugin changes

At this point, the plugin should in theory have all translation implemented. However, there is no error checking present in the plugin. A basic unit test exists for this work, but all it does it ensure that no errors occurred. The unit test also does not yet validate the content of the output object.

* Only set GrpcService if OcagentAddress is empty

This was creating an error in Envoy - if the GrpcService object being sent to Envoy had an empty string, then it would not accept the configuration.

* Final version of opencensus changes

This commit includes a translation fix and simplification of the API. Originally, we were outputting an object of type GrpcService_EnvoyGrpc_ for the grpcAddress option, but the Envoy plugin only supports the GrpcService_GoogleGrpc_ type. So we fix that here. We also simplify the protobuf API to use a oneof for specifying HTTP or GRPC.

I'm committing this now because we have decided to drop using OpenCensus due to the fact that it cannot be reconfigured. A lot of the work on this effort will be discarded, so I am saving it here for posterity.

* Rename all strings in opencensus.proto to opentelemetry

* Rename opencensus.proto to opentelemetry.proto

* Rewrite everything to use opentelemetry instead

So far, I have only tested manually, but it seems to work okay. One odd behaviour is that Envoy only seems to report information to the echo server on shutdown.

Unit tests aren't doing anything serious at the moment and need to be improved. It will also be necessary to write an e2e test for this. But otherwise, things seem to be working much more smoothly than they did with opencensus.

* Replace "Census" with "Telemetry" in function name

* Remove autogenerated opencensus documentation file

* Update unit test

* Add changelog

* Add e2e test for opentelemetry

* Update docs/content/reference/api/github.com/solo-io/gloo/projects/gloo/api/external/envoy/config/trace/v3/opentelemetry.proto.sk.md

Co-authored-by: Art <artberger@users.noreply.github.com>

* Incorporate some changes from Sam

* Remove race conditions from e2e tests

The major issue here was a pair of variables with near-global scope: collectorApiHit and collectionURLPath. Both of these were triggering go's race condition flags, probably because they were being written to and read from ginkgo's setup and teardown callbacks.

There was also an issue in shutting down the collection server, which is addressed by a comment around where the change was made.

* Some comments and docstring fixes

* Add default statements in tracing plugin type translation

* Changelog improvements

Co-authored-by: soloio-bulldozer[bot] <48420018+soloio-bulldozer[bot]@users.noreply.github.com>
Co-authored-by: Art <artberger@users.noreply.github.com>

issue.title: Fix for `glooctl check` failure
issue.body:
# Description

When running `glooctl check` on a cluster with gateway-proxy deployments that have zero replicas.

# Context

Since we expect a deployment to have at least one replica, we perform a GET which fails in the case of zero replicas since there does not exist a pod that can respond. This PR has two remedial changes:
* If the cluster has zero gateway-proxy deployments, we fail since this is considered an unhealthy install.
* For each gateway-proxy deployment that has zero replicas, we fail since the created Gateway and Proxy CRs have no way to resolve incoming traffic.

issue.title: 6983 http protocol options (#7403)

labels.name: keep pr updated
labels.description: signals bulldozer to keep pr up to date with base branch

issue.body:
* Fix HTTP protocol options issue and update unit tests

The core issue here is that we are guarding against users providing http1 options and simultaneously configuring the upstream to use http2. The original code had a simple guard `in.GetConnectionConfig() != nil` to protect this. However, this was too broad as there were other options in the `ConnectionConfig` object that should have been allowed to be specified (and weren't). Instead, it is only the `ConnectionConfig.Http1ProtocolOptions` object that has these protocol-specific optionst that we want to prevent users from enabling when http2 is selected. This fix updates the statement to use this more specific condition.

I also found that the unit tests were a bit messy here. The `createTestUpstreamWithProtocolOptions` function was updated to be a bit more direct and less abstract in the object it creates. We drop the boolean `includeProtocolSelection` boolean - it defaults to 0 anyways (`USE_CONFIGURED_PROTOCOL`), so why not just use the existing `protocolSelection` parameter to that function instead? Additionally, create parameters to set `useHttp2` and `Http1ProtocolOptions`. The tests were updated according to the new signature, and this signature makes the deny condition much easier to test for.

* Change createTestUpstreamWithProtocolOptions to use a Http1ProtocolOptions object

Instead of using a boolean, just pass the object directly into the function

* Add changelog

* Refactor tests into separate cases

* Simplify if-condition

This is will not raise a nil-pointer exception because the `ConnectionConfig` field is never dereferenced if the object it is called on is `nil`:

    func (x *Upstream) GetConnectionConfig() *ConnectionConfig {
      if x != nil {
        return x.ConnectionConfig
      }
      return nil
    }

issue.title: [DNM] Generate tunneling cluster once per route

labels.name: work in progress
labels.description: signals bulldozer to keep pr open (don't auto-merge)

labels.name: keep pr updated
labels.description: signals bulldozer to keep pr up to date with base branch

issue.body:
# Description

This fixes a bug whereby the generated cluster for an Upstream containing `httpProxyHostname` loses the UpstreamTlsContext that is otherwise included via `static.useTls`. 

We also will use Envoy's native [Internal Listeners](https://www.envoyproxy.io/docs/envoy/latest/configuration/other_features/internal_listener) in lieu of in-memory pipes to facilitate the TCP tunnel. This feature is only available in Envoy v1.22.0 and later, so backports of the bugfix above will not include this change.

# Context

Users run into this bug when generating multiple routes which route to a single CONNECT proxy upstream. The cluster that is generated by the Upstream definition should contain a `TransportSocket` which defines an `UpstreamTlsContext` when `static.useTls` is set on the Upstream. The `UpstreamTlsContext` is removed from the config when multiple routes are defined on a VirtualService pointing at the same Upstream.

# Testing
Unit tests were added to validate that an `UpstreamTlsContext` defined on a cluster persists regardless of how many of routes are created against the Upstream

labels.description: signals bulldozer to keep pr up to date with base branch

issue.body:
# Description

Can't build the race image. Also building race image on `arm64` machines takes 10 minutes to build on M1 machines, so opt out to build it by default on M1 machines.

# Context

issue.body:
# Work In Progress
This PR is an accumulated set of changes that will be backported. We can remove the label once we have each of the changes merged into this branch.

# Description

A set of recent fixes that are being backported into 1.12

# Explicitly disable leader election
Signed off by:
- [x] @jenshu 
- [x] @elcasteel 

Backport of: https://github.com/solo-io/gloo/pull/7351

Leader Election does not need to execute when only running a single replica of Gloo. We've noticed that there are certain Edge cases where leader election stops functioning properly (ApiServer throttling or network issues, node failure).

As a short-term solution, we want to make it possible so that users who are not yet trying to receiving the benefits of an HA control-plane, can disable the functionality altogether.

## Testing
### Helm e2e Testing
To confirm that the helm setting actually behaves the way we would expect in a cluster, you can follow:

1. Build the images locally, and load them into a kind cluster: 
```
CLUSTER_NAME=edge VERSION=0.0.0-edge CLUSTER_NODE_VERSION=v1.22.4  ./ci/deploy-to-kind-cluster.sh
```

2. Perform a helm install without this new value
```
helm install gloo _test/gloo-0.0.1-fork.tgz -n gloo-system --create-namespace
```

3. Observe the logs indicate the leader election is taking place
```
 kubectl logs deploy/gloo -n gloo-system -f
...

{"level":"info","ts":"2022-10-21T17:40:49.888Z","caller":"probes/healthz.go:23","msg":"healthz server starting at :8765"}
{"level":"info","ts":"2022-10-21T17:40:49.888Z","caller":"stats/stats.go:96","msg":"Stats server starting at :9091"}
{"level":"info","ts":"2022-10-21T17:40:49.897Z","logger":"gloo.v1.event_loop","caller":"v1/setup_event_loop.sk.go:79","msg":"event loop started","version":"0.0.1-fork"}
I1021 17:40:49.897247       1 leaderelection.go:248] attempting to acquire leader lease gloo-system/gloo...
I1021 17:40:49.907310       1 leaderelection.go:258] successfully acquired lease gloo-system/gloo
{"level":"info","ts":"2022-10-21T17:40:49.907Z","caller":"setup/setup.go:43","msg":"new leader elected with ID: gloo-bcdb49599-4m8pq_44e241b4-c475-4c33-b754-2190f859b9c3"}
{"level":"info","ts":"2022-10-21T17:40:49.907Z","logger":"gloo","caller":"setup/setup.go:40","msg":"starting leadership","version":"0.0.1-fork"}
```

4. Uninstall gloo edge
```
helm uninstall gloo -n gloo-system
```

5. Perform a helm install WITH the new value
```
helm install gloo _test/gloo-0.0.1-fork.tgz -n gloo-system --set gloo.disableLeaderElection=true
```

6. Observe the logs indicate that leader election IS NOT taking place
```
 kubectl logs deploy/gloo -n gloo-system -f
 ...
{"level":"info","ts":"2022-10-21T17:42:36.735Z","caller":"probes/healthz.go:23","msg":"healthz server starting at :8765"}
{"level":"info","ts":"2022-10-21T17:42:36.735Z","caller":"stats/stats.go:96","msg":"Stats server starting at :9091"}
{"level":"info","ts":"2022-10-21T17:42:36.746Z","logger":"gloo.v1.event_loop","caller":"v1/setup_event_loop.sk.go:79","msg":"event loop started","version":"0.0.1-fork"}
{"level":"info","ts":"2022-10-21T17:42:37.124Z","logger":"gloo.v1.event_loop.setup.v1.event_loop","caller":"v1/eds_event_loop.sk.go:79","msg":"event loop started","version":"0.0.1-fork"}
```

# Deflake e2e tests
Signed off by:
- [x] @bewebi 
- [x] @gunnar-solo 

Backport of PRs to resolve some recent flakes that affected our `zipkin` and `gzip` and `gateway` tests.

## Testing
Tests were updated in the main PR, and they ran through CI many times to validate the changes.

We do not expect there to be differences with 1.12.

issue.title: `glooctl check --timeout <float64>`
issue.body:
# Description

Added  --timeout flag to `glooctl check` to adjust the cluster connection check timeout.

# Context

	Prior to this change we hardcoded the timeout to five seconds which was not sufficient for large clusters given the mechanics of the check. To do this check, we create a settings client and get settings in the cluster and assure that an error has not occurred. The check would ideally be O(1) but in reality is O(#settings in cluster).

issue.title: 7406 trace context support (#7508)

labels.name: keep pr updated
labels.description: signals bulldozer to keep pr up to date with base branch

issue.body:
* Cherry-pick c511b2f6 onto master branch

Initial commit of tracing plugin changes

At this point, the plugin should in theory have all translation implemented. However, there is no error checking present in the plugin. A basic unit test exists for this work, but all it does it ensure that no errors occurred. The unit test also does not yet validate the content of the output object.

* Only set GrpcService if OcagentAddress is empty

This was creating an error in Envoy - if the GrpcService object being sent to Envoy had an empty string, then it would not accept the configuration.

* Final version of opencensus changes

This commit includes a translation fix and simplification of the API. Originally, we were outputting an object of type GrpcService_EnvoyGrpc_ for the grpcAddress option, but the Envoy plugin only supports the GrpcService_GoogleGrpc_ type. So we fix that here. We also simplify the protobuf API to use a oneof for specifying HTTP or GRPC.

I'm committing this now because we have decided to drop using OpenCensus due to the fact that it cannot be reconfigured. A lot of the work on this effort will be discarded, so I am saving it here for posterity.

* Rename all strings in opencensus.proto to opentelemetry

* Rename opencensus.proto to opentelemetry.proto

* Rewrite everything to use opentelemetry instead

So far, I have only tested manually, but it seems to work okay. One odd behaviour is that Envoy only seems to report information to the echo server on shutdown.

Unit tests aren't doing anything serious at the moment and need to be improved. It will also be necessary to write an e2e test for this. But otherwise, things seem to be working much more smoothly than they did with opencensus.

* Replace "Census" with "Telemetry" in function name

* Remove autogenerated opencensus documentation file

* Update unit test

* Add changelog

* Add e2e test for opentelemetry

* Update docs/content/reference/api/github.com/solo-io/gloo/projects/gloo/api/external/envoy/config/trace/v3/opentelemetry.proto.sk.md

Co-authored-by: Art <artberger@users.noreply.github.com>

* Incorporate some changes from Sam

* Remove race conditions from e2e tests

The major issue here was a pair of variables with near-global scope: collectorApiHit and collectionURLPath. Both of these were triggering go's race condition flags, probably because they were being written to and read from ginkgo's setup and teardown callbacks.

There was also an issue in shutting down the collection server, which is addressed by a comment around where the change was made.

* Some comments and docstring fixes

* Add default statements in tracing plugin type translation

* Changelog improvements

Co-authored-by: soloio-bulldozer[bot] <48420018+soloio-bulldozer[bot]@users.noreply.github.com>
Co-authored-by: Art <artberger@users.noreply.github.com>

issue.title: Fix for `glooctl check` failure
issue.body:
# Description

When running `glooctl check` on a cluster with gateway-proxy deployments that have zero replicas.

# Context

Since we expect a deployment to have at least one replica, we perform a GET which fails in the case of zero replicas since there does not exist a pod that can respond. This PR has two remedial changes:
* If the cluster has zero gateway-proxy deployments, we fail since this is considered an unhealthy install.
* For each gateway-proxy deployment that has zero replicas, we fail since the created Gateway and Proxy CRs have no way to resolve incoming traffic.

# Checklist:

issue.title: 6983 http protocol options (#7403)

labels.name: keep pr updated
labels.description: signals bulldozer to keep pr up to date with base branch

issue.body:
* Fix HTTP protocol options issue and update unit tests

The core issue here is that we are guarding against users providing http1 options and simultaneously configuring the upstream to use http2. The original code had a simple guard `in.GetConnectionConfig() != nil` to protect this. However, this was too broad as there were other options in the `ConnectionConfig` object that should have been allowed to be specified (and weren't). Instead, it is only the `ConnectionConfig.Http1ProtocolOptions` object that has these protocol-specific optionst that we want to prevent users from enabling when http2 is selected. This fix updates the statement to use this more specific condition.

I also found that the unit tests were a bit messy here. The `createTestUpstreamWithProtocolOptions` function was updated to be a bit more direct and less abstract in the object it creates. We drop the boolean `includeProtocolSelection` boolean - it defaults to 0 anyways (`USE_CONFIGURED_PROTOCOL`), so why not just use the existing `protocolSelection` parameter to that function instead? Additionally, create parameters to set `useHttp2` and `Http1ProtocolOptions`. The tests were updated according to the new signature, and this signature makes the deny condition much easier to test for.

* Change createTestUpstreamWithProtocolOptions to use a Http1ProtocolOptions object

Instead of using a boolean, just pass the object directly into the function

* Add changelog

* Refactor tests into separate cases

* Simplify if-condition

This is will not raise a nil-pointer exception because the `ConnectionConfig` field is never dereferenced if the object it is called on is `nil`:

    func (x *Upstream) GetConnectionConfig() *ConnectionConfig {
      if x != nil {
        return x.ConnectionConfig
      }
      return nil
    }

issue.title: [DNM] Generate tunneling cluster once per route

labels.name: work in progress
labels.description: signals bulldozer to keep pr open (don't auto-merge)

labels.name: keep pr updated
labels.description: signals bulldozer to keep pr up to date with base branch

issue.body:
# Description

This fixes a bug whereby the generated cluster for an Upstream containing `httpProxyHostname` loses the UpstreamTlsContext that is otherwise included via `static.useTls`. 

We also will use Envoy's native [Internal Listeners](https://www.envoyproxy.io/docs/envoy/latest/configuration/other_features/internal_listener) in lieu of in-memory pipes to facilitate the TCP tunnel. This feature is only available in Envoy v1.22.0 and later, so backports of the bugfix above will not include this change.

# Context

Users run into this bug when generating multiple routes which route to a single CONNECT proxy upstream. The cluster that is generated by the Upstream definition should contain a `TransportSocket` which defines an `UpstreamTlsContext` when `static.useTls` is set on the Upstream. The `UpstreamTlsContext` is removed from the config when multiple routes are defined on a VirtualService pointing at the same Upstream.

# Testing
Unit tests were added to validate that an `UpstreamTlsContext` defined on a cluster persists regardless of how many of routes are created against the Upstream

issue.body:
# Description

Can't build the race image. Also building race image on `arm64` machines takes 10 minutes to build on M1 machines, so opt out to build it by default on M1 machines.

# Context

Don't need to build the race image every time I need to build Gloo. Only needs to be built during CI builds.

issue.body:
# Work In Progress
This PR is an accumulated set of changes that will be backported. We can remove the label once we have each of the changes merged into this branch.

# Description

A set of recent fixes that are being backported into 1.12

# Explicitly disable leader election
Signed off by:
- [x] @jenshu 
- [x] @elcasteel 

Backport of: https://github.com/solo-io/gloo/pull/7351

Leader Election does not need to execute when only running a single replica of Gloo. We've noticed that there are certain Edge cases where leader election stops functioning properly (ApiServer throttling or network issues, node failure).

As a short-term solution, we want to make it possible so that users who are not yet trying to receiving the benefits of an HA control-plane, can disable the functionality altogether.

## Testing
### Helm e2e Testing
To confirm that the helm setting actually behaves the way we would expect in a cluster, you can follow:

1. Build the images locally, and load them into a kind cluster: 
```
CLUSTER_NAME=edge VERSION=0.0.0-edge CLUSTER_NODE_VERSION=v1.22.4  ./ci/deploy-to-kind-cluster.sh
```

2. Perform a helm install without this new value
```
helm install gloo _test/gloo-0.0.1-fork.tgz -n gloo-system --create-namespace
```

3. Observe the logs indicate the leader election is taking place
```
 kubectl logs deploy/gloo -n gloo-system -f
...

{"level":"info","ts":"2022-10-21T17:40:49.888Z","caller":"probes/healthz.go:23","msg":"healthz server starting at :8765"}
{"level":"info","ts":"2022-10-21T17:40:49.888Z","caller":"stats/stats.go:96","msg":"Stats server starting at :9091"}
{"level":"info","ts":"2022-10-21T17:40:49.897Z","logger":"gloo.v1.event_loop","caller":"v1/setup_event_loop.sk.go:79","msg":"event loop started","version":"0.0.1-fork"}
I1021 17:40:49.897247       1 leaderelection.go:248] attempting to acquire leader lease gloo-system/gloo...
I1021 17:40:49.907310       1 leaderelection.go:258] successfully acquired lease gloo-system/gloo
{"level":"info","ts":"2022-10-21T17:40:49.907Z","caller":"setup/setup.go:43","msg":"new leader elected with ID: gloo-bcdb49599-4m8pq_44e241b4-c475-4c33-b754-2190f859b9c3"}
{"level":"info","ts":"2022-10-21T17:40:49.907Z","logger":"gloo","caller":"setup/setup.go:40","msg":"starting leadership","version":"0.0.1-fork"}
```

4. Uninstall gloo edge
```
helm uninstall gloo -n gloo-system
```

5. Perform a helm install WITH the new value
```
helm install gloo _test/gloo-0.0.1-fork.tgz -n gloo-system --set gloo.disableLeaderElection=true
```

6. Observe the logs indicate that leader election IS NOT taking place
```
 kubectl logs deploy/gloo -n gloo-system -f
 ...
{"level":"info","ts":"2022-10-21T17:42:36.735Z","caller":"probes/healthz.go:23","msg":"healthz server starting at :8765"}
{"level":"info","ts":"2022-10-21T17:42:36.735Z","caller":"stats/stats.go:96","msg":"Stats server starting at :9091"}
{"level":"info","ts":"2022-10-21T17:42:36.746Z","logger":"gloo.v1.event_loop","caller":"v1/setup_event_loop.sk.go:79","msg":"event loop started","version":"0.0.1-fork"}
{"level":"info","ts":"2022-10-21T17:42:37.124Z","logger":"gloo.v1.event_loop.setup.v1.event_loop","caller":"v1/eds_event_loop.sk.go:79","msg":"event loop started","version":"0.0.1-fork"}
```

# Deflake e2e tests
Signed off by:
- [x] @bewebi 
- [x] @gunnar-solo 

Backport of PRs to resolve some recent flakes that affected our `zipkin` and `gzip` and `gateway` tests.

## Testing
Tests were updated in the main PR, and they ran through CI many times to validate the changes.

We do not expect there to be differences with 1.12.

# Checklist:

- [ ] I included a concise, user-facing changelog (for details, see https://github.com/solo-io/go-utils/tree/master/changelogutils) which references the issue that is resolved.
- [ ] If I updated APIs (our protos) or helm values, I ran `make -B install-go-tools generated-code` to ensure there will be no code diff
- [ ] I followed guidelines laid out in the Gloo Edge [contribution guide](https://docs.solo.io/gloo-edge/latest/contributing/)
- [ ] I opened a draft PR or added the work in progress label if my PR is not ready for review
